result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerrick R. Richey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. 
------------------------------------

No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victims. 
------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Copy of Information as orally amended on the record at the time of plea

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR.  Defendant Gerrick R. Richey in court, in custody with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attys advise the Court that this matter has been resolved.  There is a joint agreement as to plea and sentencing.  Atty Ahmad requests that sentencing date be put over to another date in a few weeks.  The agreement is for a prison sentence.  Mr. Richey is withdrawing his NGI plea.  Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Richey about withdrawing his "special plea".  Defendant enters GUILTY plea to Count #1 WITHOUT REPEATER ENHANCER.  Court makes findings, accepts plea and adjudges Mr. Richey guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.G., S.D., D.G., E.H., S.H., M.S. AND M.R.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 15-2572
